alert.note: Alert for Williams (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 11:25PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN STEUBEN...NORTHERN DE KALB AND SOUTHWESTERN WILLIAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM EDT... At 1124 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Waterloo, or near Auburn, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between mile markers 331 and 342. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
